intro: Blitum urbicum, commonly known as city blite, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of about 10–20 centimeters. The plant features small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. Blitum urbicum thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in urban environments such as sidewalks and gardens.
